intro: Veronica kavusica, commonly known as the Kavusica speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Veronica kavusica is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments.
